PSTAS_CAT_Reference_Guide.title: A Simple Reference for PSTAS-CAT to Avoid Typos and Referencing Mistakes
PSTAS_CAT_Reference_Guide.how_to_use: If you are ever unsure, copy the keys directly from this file. The keys are named to be descriptive and clear.

PSTAS_System_Definition.full_name: Programmatic Safety and Truth Assertion System
PSTAS_System_Definition.what_it_is: The whole thing. The 'PSTAS' is the name for the entire safety system, including the hardware, the software (like me, Jules), and the main goal.
PSTAS_System_Definition.main_goal: To make sure the system's actions are SAFE (timely) and CORRECT (based on truth).
PSTAS_System_Definition.think_of_it_as: The API or the Functional Requirement.

CAT_Framework_Definition.what_it_is: The '-CAT' is the set of RULES and TESTS that the PSTAS system MUST pass to be certified as safe.
CAT_Framework_Definition.think_of_it_as: The Unit Testing Framework and the Formal Proof that the PSTAS system works correctly.

breakdown.C_for_Correctness: The math behind the system's logic must be proven to be 100% sound and reliable.
breakdown.A_for_Audit: Every important number (like the 6 latency parts) must be easy for an outside expert to check and verify.
breakdown.T_for_Time-Bounded: The system MUST be deterministic. It must respect deadlines and use Worst-Case Execution Time (WCET) for all timing calculations.

rule_1_latency_formula.name: The Mandatory 6-Term WCET Latency Formula
rule_1_latency_formula.description: This is the ONLY correct formula for calculating the total time budget.
rule_1_latency_formula.formula: L_PSTAS = WCET_detect + WCET_prop + WCET_entry + WCET_SSA + WCET_TAV + WCET_actuate

rule_2_pndf_check.name: The PNDF Safety Check
rule_2_pndf_check.description: This is the core safety test that runs on the system.
violation_conditions: IF 'measured time' is GREATER THAN 'budgeted time' (WCET Overrun)
IF 'truth score' is LESS THAN 'minimum required score' (TAV Underrun)

rule_3_tav_threshold.name: The Minimum TAV Score
rule_3_tav_threshold.description: The 'truth score' (TAV) cannot fall below this number.
